description.narrative: (Bangladesh): The Climate-Resilient Ecosystems and Livelihoods (CREL) activity increases the country's resilience to natural hazards through working with community-based organizations, government ministries and technical agencies. CREL provides technical assistance to the GOB and local communities to improve ecosystem conservation and resilience capacity through mitigating threats to biodiversity, reducing greenhouse gas emissions from deforestation and improper land use, sustainable management of forests and wetlands, and diversifying the livelihoods of people living in and near protected areas to reduce unsustainable exploitation of natural resources. CREL focuses on 21 forest protected areas, four wetlands and six ecologically critical areas. It will continue assisting the GOB to improve conservation policies and regulation.
